description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b9ib9","text":"This is a brief protocol for how to measure ETRmax, alpha (Î±) and Ik for microalgae cultures using the Rapid Light Curve protocol included in the WinControl software used with a Walz Water-PAM instrument.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmvvs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nfe4","text":"Based on the protocol developed in:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"555t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ob0r","text":"Ralph, P.J., Gademann, R., 2005. Rapid light curves: a powerful tool to assess photosynthetic activity. Aquat. Bot. 82(3), 222-237.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5nci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rb4u","text":"This method was used in:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8obo8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2na3l","text":"Argyle, P. ISME Communications, 1(1), 59.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":200,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":221,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4df44","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tena","text":"Argyle, P. Frontiers in microbiology, 12, 706235.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":170,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":197,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"992sp","text":"Take a   aliquot of microalgae culture into a glass cuvette compatible with the WATER-PAM instrument. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fo926","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k5qh","text":"When the overall culture volume is limited (i.e. \u003c2 mL of culture available for the measurement), take   and dilute with sterile seawater to a final volume of  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":103,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":159,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bbko6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb0fg","text":"Notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1d0p1","text":" The optimal volume for the WATER-PAM is   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4a16q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ar04","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"44A0275062B211ECB1074BE3B6E2C2B7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5-1","error":false,"guid":"3E2138D062B511ECB1074BE3B6E2C2B7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"1643618062B511ECB1074BE3B6E2C2B7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2-3","error":false,"guid":"0D953E5062B511ECB1074BE3B6E2C2B7","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4a4bs","text":"Set up the WATER-PAM according to the manufacturer's instructions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67a35","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"619j8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"11ctk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhi80","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ll4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"equipment","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":2982,"brand":"WALZ","can_edit":0,"guid":"74DB45E062B611ECB1074BE3B6E2C2B7","link":"https://www.walz.com/products/chl_p700/water-pam/introduction.html","name":"Water-PAM","sku":"WATER-PAM-II","specifications":null,"type":"PAM fluorometer","vendor":{"id":410,"name":"Walz","link":"http://www.walz.com/","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}},"file":null,"image":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2f8j0","text":"Initiate a Rapid Light Curve by clicking Program \u003e Light Curve in WinControl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvp2j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bip9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"21ehk","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4oqtg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h65i","text":"To achieve a successful RLC, there should be at least 3 points on the rise, multiple points to estimate the ETRmax, and at least one point on the decline at the highest irradiance (see instrument manual). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jl3d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22f8d","text":"If the curve does not achieve these criteria, this may require optimization of the instrument settings such as the gain and irradiance steps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32d6n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51epe","text":"Modify the Light Curve Intensity (LI) to change the first irrandiance step of the curve, keeping in mind there will always be 8 steps to the curve. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"blnhc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ducb","text":"Gain settings should be adjusted by the user, if Fo or Fm exceeds the maximum value (\u003e4000) then reduce the gain, or dilute the sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o6o7","text":"NB: Do not adjust the gain settings in between samples as this renders the data incomparable. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sg44","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9es04","text":"The curve width is usually set to 10 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ptv9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dms6c","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b68mv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1iipl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o55l","text":"NB: If comparing different cultures, it is important to conduct all measurements within a similar time window based on the photoperiod. I.e. within a 1-2 hour window 2 hours after the onset of light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6AF7C51062B811ECB1074BE3B6E2C2B7","height":309,"id":344704,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswcba5if.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswaba5if.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswbba5if.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksv9ba5if.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8E879F0062B811ECB1074BE3B6E2C2B7","height":309,"id":344708,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswgba5if.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ksweba5if.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswfba5if.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswdba5if.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6226898062B811ECB1074BE3B6E2C2B7","height":309,"id":344712,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswkba5if.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswiba5if.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswjba5if.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/kswhba5if.webp","width":550}}}}
